newsitem.title: JAPAN: Indonesia cuts Dec crude export allocation-traders.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia cuts Dec crude export allocation-traders.

text.p: Indonesia has cut crude export allocations in December to 235,000 barrels per day (bpd) from 282,000 bpd a month earlier, traders said on Monday.
State-owned Pertamina allocated 69,000 bpd of Minas crude compared with 71,000 bpd in November.

Allocations of other major crudes were Widuri at 30,000 bpd against 18,000 bpd in November, Cinta at 24,000 bpd against 19,000 bpd, Duri at 30,000 against 80,000 and Belida at 12,000, unchanged from November.
Traders said the December allocation was widely within expectations.

They said Pertamina's allocations in November and October had been considerably larger than usual because more Duri crude was diverted to the export market during those months owing to scheduled maintenance work at a crude distillation unit at the EXOR-1 refinery.
